alert.note: Alert for Bossier; Caddo; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 23 at 4:13PM CST until January 23 at 7:15PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas, including the following counties, Columbia and Union and northwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, Bienville, Bossier, Caddo, Claiborne, De Soto and Webster. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 413 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Minden, Springhill, Homer, Haughton, Haynesville, Stonewall, Ringgold, Sibley, Cullen, Cotton Valley, Gibsland, Sarepta, Doyline, Emerson, Dixie Inn, Dubberly, Heflin and Shongaloo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
